intro: Belvala argentea, commonly known as silver belvala, is a striking plant characterized by its silvery-white foliage. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Belvala argentea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across its native range.
